Description.Text:
Location
This hotel enjoys an excellent location in the most bohemian and historical part of Buenos Aires, San Telmo. Surrounded by art galleries, antique shops and restaurants, and right across from the famous Plaza Dorrego that hosts the best flea market in the city on weekends, the hotel also offers quick and easy access to the major financial, commercial, tourist and enetrtainment areas of Buenos Aires.
Facilities
Relaxation and tranquility prevail on the terrace and the open green spaces come into perfect harmony with the surrounding environment, inviting guests to relax in the chairs and armchairs. In the morning guests can enjoy a continental breakfast at the restaurant. Renovated in 2012, the air-conditioned, 9-room historical hotel offers a friendly atmosphere with music and drinks 24 hours a day in the bar, accompanied by good music. Further facilities include a lobby with 24-hour reception, a hotel safe, cloakroom, caf√©, wireless Internet access and room service.
Rooms
The rooms feature sleek design and modern amenities such as a flat-screen TV, free Internet access and cordless telephones. The bathrooms have a shower, bathtub, hairdryer and luxurious bath products. A double or king-size bed, a radio, safe, minibar, individually regulated air conditioning and heating, and a private balcony or terrace also feature as standard.
Sports/Entertainment
There is a sun terrace with parasols, and guests can relax in the hot tub or with a massage (for a fee).
Meals
A continental breakfast is served each morning.
Payment
American Express, Diners Club, JCB, MasterCard and VISA are accepted as methods of payment.

LocationThis hotel enjoys an excellent location in the most bohemian and historical part of Buenos Aires; San Telmo. Surrounded by art galleries; antique shops and restaurants; and right across from the famous Plaza Dorrego that hosts the best flea market in the city on weekends; the hotel also offers quick and easy access to the major financial; commercial; tourist and enetrtainment areas of Buenos Aires.
